title: 5 years later Valve finally gives Windows compatibility tool Proton a logo
description: Can you believe it? Proton, the compatibility layer that allows Windows games to run on Steam Deck / Linux PCs didn't actually have a proper logo for over 5 years.

title: NVIDIA disclose new driver security issues - Feb 28
description: NVIDIA has revealed new GPU driver security issues in their latest bulletin, so here's what you need to know if you're using an NVIDIA GPU on Linux.

title: Lots more content is coming to Last Epoch and controller support improvements
description: Last Epoch recently released on Steam with Native Linux support, an offline mode and controller support but the developers at Eleventh Hour Games plan to keep improving it all.

title: nullptr is an action puzzle hacking game where every second counts
description: Due to release sometime in Q3 2024, developer Jeferson Silva has recently put up a demo for their action puzzle hacking game nullptr.

title: Lots of exciting updates coming to the free & open source RPG Veloren
description: Veloren, the free and open source action-adventure role-playing voxel game made in Rust keeps evolving. Since its last public v0.15 release in July 2023, much has changed and lots of improvements were made so far.

title: Remote Play broken on Steam Deck with the February stable update
description: Valve just recently launched a big stable update to the Steam Client for both Steam Deck and Desktop PCs, which has come with one big issue for Steam Deck.

title: The future has arrived - KDE Plasma 6 desktop released
description: The KDE team announced "MegaRelease 6", a big upgrade that includes Plasma 6, Frameworks 6 and Gear 24.02 with tons of improvements to this popular desktop environment that's used on the Steam Deck for Desktop Mode.
